Activity: Arrive at office, review calendar, and check for urgent emails. Quick scan of EHR-related industry news.
Continue drafting the technical specification document, focusing on data mapping and transformation requirements. Website Browsing: Look at public health data dashboards for inspiration.
Meet with @his-1 (Health Informatics Specialist) to discuss data standardization and coding requirements for influenza-related data. @PEOPLE: his-1; Topic: Data Standardization for Influenza Data
Research potential data mapping tools that can automate the process of transforming EHR data into a standardized format.

Lunch Break. Relax and read a technical article.
Work on data mapping specifications for diagnosis codes (ICD-10), medication codes (RxNorm), and lab results (LOINC) related to influenza.

Contact @da-1 (Data Analyst) to discuss the statistical methods and reporting requirements for seasonal influenza trend analysis. @PEOPLE: da-1; Topic: Statistical Methods for Influenza Trend Analysis
Document the required data elements for the influenza trend analysis, including patient demographics, vaccination status, and clinical outcomes.
Review technical specification document. Prepare for EHR vendor meeting by consolidating key questions and anticipated challenges.
